paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the TTR gene and its variants, specifically focusing on the V30M mutation, its penetrance, and associated clinical data.

patients.phenotype: peripheral polyneuropathy or autonomic polyneuropathy without signs of amyloid deposition

individual_records.evidence_sentence: ATTR individuals at the time of sample collection and ATTR transplanted individual at the time of transplantation showed peripheral polyneuropathy or autonomic polyneuropathy without signs of amyloid deposition.

ATTR individuals at the time of sample collection and ATTR transplanted individual at the time of transplantation showed peripheral polyneuropathy or autonomic polyneuropathy without signs of amyloid deposition.

individual_records.phenotype_details: no symptoms 8 years after the onset of his brother disease
individual_records.evidence_sentence: In a case, one of the twins underwent liver transplantation, whereas the other is completely healthy, showing no symptoms 8 years after the onset of his brother disease.
In a case, one of the twins underwent liver transplantation, whereas the other is completely healthy, showing no symptoms 8 years after the onset of his brother disease.

functional_data.summary: The V30M mutation leads to a peptide with a mass shift, indicating a change in the protein structure.

variants.segregation_data: The V30M mutation segregates with disease in families, as evidenced by the affected and unaffected status of twins.
variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the variability in disease onset among carriers of the V30M mutation.
key_quotes: Discordant disease progression in homozygote twins From Sweden and Spain was reported.
Homozygous ATTR V30M patients appear not to develop a more aggressive disease than heterozygous ones.

extraction_metadata.notes: Data was extracted thoroughly from the main text, focusing on the TTR gene and its variants.
